intro: Narcissus radiiflorus f. dianthus, commonly known as the dianthus narcissus, is a rare and ornamental plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, cup-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with a distinctive red or pinkish hue at the base. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces a single stem that bears the showy flower. It is native to specific regions in southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its rarity and unique appearance, it is highly valued in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
